required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Eligible TAVI-valves - Cohort B
clinical_study.official_title: Randomized Comparison of Eligible TAVI-valves - Cohort B (Sapien Versus Myval)

brief_summary.textblock: The study performs head-to-head comparison of two TAVI-valves: Sapien and Myval.

detailed_description.textblock:
The purpose of the present study is to ensure a continuous comparison of the TAVI-valves implanted, and to monitor long-term valve performances.
Purpose: To randomize between two TAVI-valve types in patients who according to a heart team conference is found eligible for treatment with more than one valve.
Hypotheses:
1. There is no difference in the combined endpoint (death, stroke, moderate/severe para-valvular leakage, moderate/severe device stenosis) between the two valves to be compared.
2. There is no difference between valves in secondary endpoints: death, stroke, moderate/major paravalvular leakage, moderate/severe aortic device stenosis, new pacemaker implantation, readmission for congestive heart failure, 6-minute walk test, and degeneration of the valve as evaluated by computerized tomography (HCT), transthoracic echocardiography (TTE), transesophageal echocardiography (TEE), or MRI.
Design: Randomized controlled trial with clinical national registry follow-up.
Centers eligible for inclusion: Scandinavian and European centers who fulfill the above mentioned criteria.
Randomization:
Before randomizing patients, the center decides which two valves the patient is found eligible for, and enters these valves in the electronic randomization form (TrialPartner). Randomization is then performed between these two valves. A patient is only randomized if a dedicated technical TAVI conference has found the patient eligible for treatment with both valves.
Consecutive cohorts are established.
In the current study we plan to initiate the following cohorts:
Cohort B: Patients randomized to the Sapien or the Myval TAVI valve.
Operator requirements:
Any procedure requires that the physician has performed at least 15 implantations with the valve in use. Otherwise the procedure is performed according to the routine of the institution.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of patients with MACE (Major Adverse Cardiovascular Events)
primary_outcome.description: Mortality, stroke, moderate/major PVL, moderate/severe aortic device stenosis at 1 year, using VARC-2 criteria

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of patients with MACE
secondary_outcome.description: Mortality, stroke, moderate/major paravalvular leakage (PVL), moderate/severe aortic device stenosis at 1 year, using VARC-2 criteria

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage death
secondary_outcome.description: Mortality

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of patients with stroke
secondary_outcome.description: According to Valve Academic Research Consortium (VARC)-2 criteria

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of patients with moderate or severe paravalvular leakage
secondary_outcome.description: Moderate or severe paravalvular leakage according to VARC-2 criteria

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of patients with moderate/major aortic stenosis
secondary_outcome.description: According to VARC-2 criteria

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of patients with new pacemaker
secondary_outcome.description: New Pacemaker after TAVI-procedure

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of patients with major bleeding
secondary_outcome.description: Major bleeding according to Bleeding Academic Research Consortium (BARC) type 3 or 5 criteria

secondary_outcome.measure: Distance in meters during 6-minute walk test
secondary_outcome.description: 6-minute walk test

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of patients with other TAVI-related complications
secondary_outcome.description: conversion to open surgery during implantation, unplanned use of cardiopulmonary support (CPS), coronary artery obstruction, ventricular septal perforation, mitral valve apparatus damage or dysfunction, cardiac tamponade, valve thrombosis, valve embolization, valve migration, need for TAVI-in-TAVI deployment, using VARC-2 criteria

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of patients with endocarditis
secondary_outcome.description: Endocarditis

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion with successful implantation of the chosen valve.
secondary_outcome.description: This means no need for more than 1 TAVI valve, no change to another valve than planned during the procedure because it was impossible to implant the valve planned, and no conversion to surgery or procedure-related death.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of patients with major vascular access site and access-related complications
secondary_outcome.description: According to VARC-2 criteria

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of patients with valve thrombosis or severe stenosis
secondary_outcome.description: Valve thrombosis or severe stenosis confirmed by Echo or HCT

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of patients with readmission with congestive heart failure
secondary_outcome.description: Readmission with congestive heart failure

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of patients with increase in creatinin level of 200% or more
secondary_outcome.description: Increase in renal creatinine level more than to >=200% (AKIN stage 2-3, VARC-2 criteria)

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of patients with moderate/severe PVL stratified according to level of annular calcium on HCT in three groups
secondary_outcome.description: Severity of PVL stratified according to level of annular calcium on HCT (low/medium/high)

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Gradient (AO) stratified according to level of annular calcium on HCT in three groups
secondary_outcome.description: Gradient (AO) stratified according to level of annular calcium on HCT (low/medium/high)

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of patients with prosthesis-patient mismatch
secondary_outcome.description: Prosthesis-patient mismatch (EOA/body surface area). Severe PPM≤0.65 cm2/m2. Moderate PPM≤0.85 cm2/m2

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean effective orifice area measured by MRI
secondary_outcome.description: Effective orifice area measured by MRI

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of patients with leaflet thickening (hypoattenuated leaflet thickening = HALT) or reduced leaflet motion or thrombus assessed by HCT
secondary_outcome.description: Leaflet thickening (hypoattenuated leaflet thickening = HALT) or reduced leaflet motion or thrombus assessed by HCT

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean volume of aortic regurgitation measured by MRI
secondary_outcome.description: Volume of aortic regurgitation measured by MRI

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Patient more than 18 years of age.
2. Patient eligible for at least 2 valves being implanted routinely at the participating center, according to a TAVI heart team conference.
3. The center experience for each of the valves considered should be more than 15 cases a year, and at least 15 valves implanted before a valve can be used in the trial.
4. The center volume should be more than 75 cases a year.
5. The patient has given signed informed consent.
6. TAVI performed via the femoral artery.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Not able to give written inform consent

patient_data.ipd_description: Normally this will be possible when data are published and anonymized. Mainly to support meta-analysis on individual level data.
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: When endpoints are published in an international peer-reviewed paper
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: To share data there shall be a well-defined purpose. This could be to contribute to a meta-analysis on individual level data.
